snippet.title: How have New York and New Jersey reduced smoking?
snippet.description: * How have New York and New Jersey reduced smoking? From 1992-2002 cigarette smoking prevalence in New York City remained relatively stable, with around 21-22% of adults being smokers. However, in 2002 the city began to implement a comprehensive five-point tobacco control plan, as follows:1. Increased...

snippet.title: More People Falling Ill as Lawmakers Battle Over Paid Sick Leave
snippet.description: * More People Falling Ill as Lawmakers Battle Over Paid Sick Leave Florida and New York City are the latest battlegrounds in the fight between workers and the food service industry over mandated sick pay.

snippet.title: Study: Unvaccinated Children Are 'Kindling' for Outbreaks
snippet.description: * Study: Unvaccinated Children Are 'Kindling' for Outbreaks Using disease outbreaks in the wild as a model, researchers show that seasonal birth rates and kids' vaccination schedules could impact outbreaks of measles.
